text: Charles Edward McGee (December 7, 1919 âˆ’ January 16, 2022) was an African- American fighter pilot. He was one of the Tuskegee Airmen"Misconceptions About the Tuskegee Airmen." Air Force Historical Research Agency. Retrieved: February 16, 2018. and a career officer in the United States Air Force for 30 years who flew a total of 409 combat missions in World War II, Korea and Vietnam.Maw, Michael. "Tuskeegee Airman Presented Distinguished Eagle Scout Award: 2010 National Scout Jamboree." Boy Scouts of America. Retrieved: January 23, 2011. McGee was born in Cleveland, Ohio. McGee died in his sleep on January 16, 2022 in Bethesda, Maryland, at the age of 102. ==References== ==Other websites== * Aviation History: Interview with Tuskegee Airman Charles McGee * McGee biography in the National Aviation Hall of Fame * Colonel Charles E. title: Charles E. McGee
